item.title: 香港调查路易威登数据泄露事件，41.9万人受影响
item.description: 香港私隐监察机构周一表示，它正在调查路易威登的数据泄露事件，该事件影响到约41.9万名客户。【原文：Hong Kong's privacy watchdog said on Monday that it was investigating a data leak at Louis Vuitton affecting about 419,000 customers, just after a cyberattack on the luxury brand in South Korea in June.】

item.title: 微软将帮助法国展示巴黎圣母院的数字复制品
item.description: 微软公司总裁布拉德-史密斯（Brad Smith）周一表示，微软正在与法国政府合作，为法国游客最多的古迹--巴黎圣母院大教堂制作一个数字复制品。【原文：Microsoft is teaming up with the French government to create a digital replica of Paris' Notre-Dame Cathedral, France's most visited monument, the U.S. tech company's president, Brad Smith, said on Monday.】

item.title: 受关税影响，汽车制造商 Stellantis 半年净亏损 26.8 亿美元
item.description: 汽车制造商斯泰兰特周一表示，预计 2025 年上半年将净亏损 23 亿欧元（26.8 亿美元）。【原文：Automaker Stellantis expects a net loss of 2.3 billion euros ($2.68 billion) for the first half of 2025, it said on Monday, as it forecast an initial hit of 0.3 billion euros from U.S. import tariffs on its half-year results.】

item.title: 英伟达首席执行官的中国魅力攻势彰显其在关键市场的摇滚明星地位
item.description: 英伟达公司首席执行官黄仁勋（Jensen Huang）对北京并不陌生，但最近的一次访问，也是他今年第三次访问中国，巩固了他在中国的摇滚明星地位。【原文：Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang is no stranger to Beijing, but his most recent visit, his third to China this year, cemented his rock star status in the country, where fans mingled freely with the AI titan on the streets of the capital.】

item.title: 中国否认与被控攻击新加坡关键基础设施的间谍组织有关联
item.description: 中国驻新加坡大使馆驳斥了关于一个被指控对新加坡关键基础设施实施网络攻击的间谍组织与中国有关的说法。【原文：The Chinese embassy in Singapore refuted claims that an espionage group accused of performing cyberattacks on Singapore's critical infrastructure was linked to China.】

item.title: 欧洲化工行业寻求生存之道
item.description: 经过多年亏损和以中国为首的全球产能迅速扩张，欧洲石化工业在工厂倒闭浪潮中逐渐瓦解。【原文：Europe's petrochemical industry is unravelling under a wave of plant closures after years of losses and a rapid expansion of global capacity led by China.】

item.title: 稀土出口回升，中国两种重要矿产出口却大幅下滑
item.description: 过去三个月里，中国用于武器、电信和太阳能电池的两种重要矿产的出口量急剧下降，原因是中国最高间谍机构参与了对走私和转运的打击。【原文：China's exports of two critical minerals used in weapons, telecommunications and solar cells have plunged over the past three months amid a crackdown on smuggling and transshipment that has involved China's top spy agency.】

item.title: 英国石油公司任命 Albert Manifold 为新主席
item.description: 英国石油公司（BP）周一任命阿尔伯特-曼福德（Albert Manifold）接替海尔格-伦德（Helge Lund）担任新主席。【原文：BP named Albert Manifold as its new chairman on Monday, succeeding Helge Lund.】

item.title: 关闭和处置重塑全球石化行业
item.description: 随着世界各地的公司在适应中国产能增加和欧洲成本上升的同时，重新考虑其市场风险，一波关闭和处置浪潮正在重塑全球石化行业。【原文：A wave of closures and disposals is reshaping the global petrochemical sector as companies around the world rethink their exposure to markets as they adjust to capacity build-up in China and higher costs in Europe.】

item.title: 瑞安航空 4-6 月净利润因复活节时机和票价反弹而翻番
item.description: 欧洲最大的低成本航空公司瑞安航空（Ryanair）周一表示，得益于复活节假期的时机以及最后一分钟票价好于预期，该公司 4-6 月份的净利润增长了一倍多。【原文：Ryanair's net profit more than doubled in its April-June quarter, thanks to the timing of Easter holidays and better-than-expected last-minute fares, Europe's largest low-cost carrier said on Monday.】

item.title: 喘口气：欧洲央行的五个问题
item.description: 在连续八次降息后，欧洲央行周四将暂停喘息，美国加征关税的前景比预期更为严峻。【原文：The European Central Bank is set to pause for breath on Thursday after eight consecutive interest rate cuts, with the prospect of steeper-than-expected U.S. tariffs looming.】

item.title: 早间竞价情况可能更糟，但对日元而言已足够
item.description: 韦恩-科尔对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Wayne Cole】

item.title: 对冲基金在上议院选举前抛售日本股票，高盛称
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs）在一份报告中说，就在周日日本上议院选举之前，全球对冲基金上周以近两个半月来最迅猛的速度抛售了日本股票。【原文：Global hedge funds offloaded Japanese equities at the sharpest pace in almost two-and-a-half months last week, just ahead of the country's upper house election on Sunday, Goldman Sachs said in a note.】

item.title: 塞缪尔-格林重新加入高盛，领导悉尼房地产投资团队
item.description: 根据路透社周一看到的一份内部备忘录，高盛已任命塞缪尔-格林（Samuel Green）为其悉尼房地产投资团队的董事总经理。【原文：Goldman Sachs has appointed Samuel Green as managing director of its Sydney-based real estate investing team, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters on Monday.】

item.title: 美国联邦航空局称阿拉斯加航空公司要求所有干线飞机停飞
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局（FAA）的状态页面周日显示，阿拉斯加航空公司已要求其所有干线飞机停飞。【原文：Alaska Airlines has requested a ground stop for all its mainline aircraft, the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) status page said on Sunday.】

item.title: 投资者关注对俄新制裁的影响，油价变化不大
item.description: 周一，石油价格几乎没有波动，因为交易商们在关注欧洲对俄罗斯石油供应实施新制裁的影响、中东生产商产量的增加以及关税拖累全球经济增长对燃料前景的担忧。【原文：Oil prices barely budged on Monday as traders eyed the impact of new European sanctions on Russian oil supply, rising output from Middle East producers and concerns about fuel outlook as tariffs weighed on global economic growth.】

item.title: 亚洲股市和日元经受住了日本财报不确定性的考验
item.description: 周一，亚洲股市和日元保持坚挺，因为日本大选对政府不利，但没有比预期的更糟。【原文：Asian shares and the yen held their ground on Monday as Japanese elections proved bad for the government but no worse than already priced in, while Wall Street futures braced for earnings from the first of the tech giants.】

item.title: 日元坚挺，投资者为政治不确定性做好准备
item.description: 在日本执政联盟失去上议院多数席位后，日元周一走强，投资者担心在与美国关税谈判的最后期限到来之前，这个世界第四大经济体将陷入政策瘫痪和市场动荡。【原文：The yen firmed on Monday after Japan's ruling coalition lost its majority in the upper house as investors braced for a period of policy paralysis and market tumult in the world's fourth-largest economy ahead of a deadline on tariff negotiations with the U.S.】

item.title: 微软提醒企业和政府注意服务器软件攻击
item.description: 微软发布了关于政府机构和企业在组织内部共享文档时使用的服务器软件受到 "主动攻击 "的警报，并建议客户立即应用安全更新。【原文：Microsoft has issued an alert about "active attacks" on server software used by government agencies and businesses to share documents within organizations, and it recommended security updates that customers should apply immediately.】

item.title: 投资者称日本执政党大选失利是代价所在
item.description: 分析师说，日本周日举行的上议院选举对执政联盟造成了沉重打击，并使市场面临可能的政策瘫痪和更大的财政赤字。【原文：Japan's upper house election on Sunday dealt a big blow to the ruling coalition and sets markets up for possible policy paralysis and a bigger fiscal deficit, much of which is already priced in, analysts said.】

item.title: 商务部长卢特尼克表示相信美国将与欧盟达成贸易协议
item.description: 美国商务部长霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）周日表示，他有信心美国能与欧盟达成贸易协议，但8月1日是关税生效的最后期限。【原文：U.S. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said on Sunday he was confident the United States can secure a trade deal with the European Union, but August 1 is a hard deadline for tariffs to kick in.】

item.title: 中国 Zeekr 称未销售或注册零里程二手车
item.description: 中国汽车公司 Zeekr 周日在一份声明中说，媒体报道中描述的零里程二手车是已投保的展览车，但该公司并未销售或注册这些车辆。【原文：Chinese automotive firm Zeekr said in a statement on Sunday that used cars described in media reports as having zero mileage were exhibition cars that were insured, but it did not sell or register them.】

item.title: 6 月份中国对美国的稀土磁铁出口猛增
item.description: 分析师说，由于 6 月份有更多的出口商获得了许可证，7 月份磁铁的出货量可能会进一步恢复。【原文：Shipments of magnets are likely to recover further in July as more exporters obtained licences in June, analysts said.】

item.title: 天文学家公司首席执行官在接吻视频疯传后辞职
item.description: 科技公司 Astronomer Inc. 周六表示，该公司首席执行官在摇滚音乐会上与一名并非其妻子的女子亲热时被摄像头拍到，因此已经辞职。【原文：The CEO of the technology firm Astronomer Inc. has resigned after being caught canoodling on camera at a rock concert with a woman who was not his wife, the company said on Saturday.】

item.title: 据 The Information 报道，英伟达在华重启生产面临障碍
item.description: 据《The Information》周六报道，英伟达（Nvidia）已告知其中国客户，根据美国出口限制，该公司获准向中国出售的最强大的人工智能芯片--H20芯片供应有限，且不打算重启生产。【原文：Nvidia has told its Chinese customers it has limited supplies of H20 chips, the most powerful AI chip it had been allowed to sell to China under U.S. export restrictions, and that it doesn't plan to restart production, The Information reported on Saturday.】

item.title: 独家报道中国电动汽车品牌Zeekr和Neta利用保险计划虚增汽车销量
item.description: 根据路透社查阅的文件以及对经销商和买家的采访，中国电动汽车品牌网大和极客近年来夸大了销量，以达到激进的目标，其中网大夸大了6万多辆汽车的销量。【原文：Chinese electric vehicle brands Neta and Zeekr inflated sales in recent years to hit aggressive targets, with Neta doing so for more than 60,000 cars, according to documents reviewed by Reuters and interviews with dealers and buyers.】

item.title: 中国计划禁止新车在注册后六个月内转售
item.description: 周六，一份行业协会出版物称，中国工业部正计划禁止新车在注册后六个月内转售，以解决零里程二手车的销售问题。【原文：China's industry ministry is planning to ban the resale of new cars within six months after their registration, an industry association publication said on Saturday, in an attempt to address sales of zero-mileage used cars.】

item.title: 据 ANI 报道，印度就博彩应用程序案传唤谷歌和 Meta
item.description: 据 ANI 新闻社周六援引官方消息报道，印度负责调查经济犯罪的执法局已传唤谷歌和 Meta 的代表，要求他们在周一就一起涉及博彩应用程序的案件出庭。【原文：India's Enforcement Directorate agency, which probes economic crimes, has summoned representatives from Google and Meta to appear on Monday in connection with a case involving betting apps, ANI news agency reported on Saturday, citing official sources.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息人士称，Blackstone 退出财团对 TikTok US 的竞购
item.description: 一位熟悉此事的消息人士周五告诉路透社，私募股权投资巨头 Blackstone 已退出寻求投资 TikTok 美国业务的财团。【原文：Private equity giant Blackstone has withdrawn from a consortium seeking to invest in TikTok’s U.S. operations, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters on Friday.】

item.title: Perplexity 正与手机制造商洽谈在设备上预装 Comet AI 移动浏览器事宜
item.description: 由英伟达（Nvidia）支持的Perplexity AI（一家以人工智能搜索引擎挑战谷歌的初创公司）首席执行官阿拉温德-斯里尼瓦斯（Aravind Srinivas）周五告诉路透社，该公司正在与移动设备制造商商讨在智能手机上预装其新的Comet浏览器。【原文：Nvidia-backed Perplexity AI, the startup challenging Google with its AI-powered search engine, is in discussions with mobile device makers to pre-install its new Comet browser on smartphones, CEO Aravind Srinivas told Reuters on Friday.】
